title: Raphinha scores two goals as Barcelona defeat Osasuna in La Liga
summary: Raphinha's brace helped Barcelona overcome Osasuna and open up a seven-point lead on Real Madrid at top of the ladder.

title: Gaza to Dublin: A journey through war, displacement, hope
summary: 'Survival comes with weight,' writes Rawand Alagha in an essay about the pain of leaving Gaza.

title: Wembanyama, Spurs stun OKC Thunder to make NBA Cup final
summary: Victor Wembanyama and San Antonio progress to the NBA Cup championship game after beating the defending NBA champions.

title: Video: Key terms you should know from the Bosnia war
summary: It’s been 30 years since the Bosnia war ended, but the conflict still shapes the country today.

title: Thailand-Cambodia live: Renewed border clashes as fighting enters 2nd week
summary: Renewed border clashes between Cambodia and Thailand entered a second week.

title: Philippines says fishermen hurt, boat damaged in China coastguard skirmish
summary: The Philippine coastguard claims the vessels it deployed to aid the injured fishermen were also repeatedly blocked.

title: Thailand launches new offensive as Cambodia halts all border crossings
summary: A Royal Thai Navy spokesman says its military launched an operation to reclaim border 'territories' in Trat province.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,389
summary: These are the key developments from day 1,389 of Russia's war on Ukraine.

title: Manhunt under way for shooter after two students killed at Brown University
summary: Over 400 law enforcement personnel deployed as search continues for the suspect of shooting in US state of Rhode Island.

title: Alaves vs Real Madrid: La Liga – team news, start time, lineups
summary: Real Madrid have only won two of their last eight matches piling pressure on their manager Xabi Alonso for Alaves trip.

title: Hungarian protesters demand PM Viktor Orban quit over child abuse scandals
summary: Orban's government has been rocked by several child-abuse scandals in recent years.

title: UN chief condemns ‘horrific’ drone attack in Sudan as 6 peacekeepers killed
summary: Bangladeshi peacekeepers were killed in the attack on Kadugli, which the Sudanese army has blamed on the RSF.

title: Syrie : trois Américains, dont deux soldats, abattus par un "tireur isolé de l'EI"
summary: Deux soldats et un civil américains, membres d'une délégation commune, ont été tués samedi en Syrie à la suite d'une "embuscade par un tireur isolé" de l'organisation État islamique, a annoncé l'armée américaine. Donald Trump a aussitôt promis que les États-Unis riposteraient à cette attaque.

title: L'armée israélienne affirme avoir tué un haut commandant du Hamas à Gaza
summary: L'un des principaux commandants de la branche armée du Hamas a été tué samedi dans une frappe israélienne à Gaza, a déclaré samedi un responsable militaire israélien. Raed Saad était considéré comme l'un des architectes des attaques du 7 octobre 2023 en Israël.

title: Bethléem se prépare à célébrer les fêtes de Noël
summary: Dans la ville de Bethléem, en Cisjordanie occupée, on se prépare à célébrer les fêtes de Noël, ce qui n'était plus le cas depuis le début de la guerre à Gaza. Les pèlerins se font cependant rares. Un sujet de nos confrères de France 2.

title: Avorter en Afghanistan : comment les femmes sont poussées à risquer leur vie
summary: Privées de contraception et d'accès aux soins, contraintes d'avorter en secret, des Afghanes racontent les risques qu'elles prennent pour interrompre une grossesse non désirée. Une réalité qui révèle l'effondrement des droits sexuels et reproductifs des femmes sous le régime taliban.

title: En Israël, la ruée vers les armes des femmes après le 7-Octobre
summary: Depuis les attaques terroristes du 7 octobre 2023, Israël a délivré quelque 217 000 nouveaux permis de port d’armes à des civils. Parmi les nouveaux détenteurs : une proportion croissante de femmes. Mères de famille, religieuses ou laïques, vivant dans des colonies comme dans les villages aisés de la côte israélienne, elles défendent toutes l’extension du droit au port d’armes, qu’elles souhaitent voir se généraliser dans leur société. Nos correspondantes, Claire Duhamel et Solène Chalvon-Fioriti, ont enquêté au cœur d’un Israël toujours plus radicalisé, qui mise sur les armes pour assurer sa sécurité.

title: Iran : la prix Nobel de la paix 2023 Narges Mohammadi a été arrêtée
summary: La prix Nobel de la paix 2023, Narges Mohammadi, a été arrêtée vendredi en Iran selon son comité de soutien. La militante mène des combats contre le voile obligatoire pour les femmes et la peine de mort.

title: L'émiratisation de l'économie : le virage des Émirats Arabes Unis
summary: Aux Émirats arabes unis, le gouvernement a imposé des quotas d’embauche des citoyens émiratis dans le secteur privé, pour qu’ils constituent 10% de la main-d'œuvre d’ici 2026. Comment les entreprises se plient-elles à ces nouvelles règles, et comment changer les habitudes d’une population longtemps habituée aux subventions généreuses et aux emplois gouvernementaux peu contraignants ? Reportage de Sophie Guignon et Amélie Zaccour.

title: Israël refuse un simple "gel" de l'armement du Hamas à Gaza, qui doit être "démilitarisée"
summary: Le Hamas "sera désarmé" dans le cadre du plan Trump, a réaffirmé jeudi un responsable gouvernemental israélien, au lendemain de la proposition d'un dirigeant du mouvement islamiste palestinien de geler son armement.

title: Bande de Gaza: de fortes pluies inondent les tentes des déplacés
summary: Avec l’arrivée de l’hiver, de nombreux Palestiniens déplacés vivent désormais dans des tentes envahies par les eaux de pluie, notamment dans le quartier de Zeitoun, dans l’est de la ville de Gaza.

title: En Cisjordanie, le "régime de terreur" imposé par Israël
summary: A la Une de la presse, ce jeudi 11 décembre 2025, la situation humanitaire catastrophique à Gaza, frappée depuis hier par la tempête Byron, et les et violences sans précédent commises par Israël en Cisjordanie. L’entrée du caftan marocain et de la cuisine italienne au patrimoine immatériel de l’humanité. Une consécration, mais aussi une occasion unique d’asticoter le voisin.

title: Gaza : Khaled Mechaal propose le gel de l'armement du Hamas en échange d'une trêve à long terme
summary: Khaled Mechaal, ancien numéro un du Hamas, a affirmé mercredi dans un entretien à Al Jazeera rejeter un "désarmement total" du mouvement islamiste, jugé "inacceptable", lui préférant "un gel ou un stockage" des armes. Il s'est par ailleurs montré ouvert à la présence d'une force internationale de maintien de la paix à la frontière avec Israël.

title: Au Yémen, les avancées territoriales des séparatistes font craindre une nouvelle guerre civile
summary: Un mouvement séparatiste, pourtant membre du gouvernement internationalement reconnu, s'est emparé de provinces riches en pétrole dans le sud du Yémen, brisant une trêve fragile dans la guerre civile et renforçant les divisions dans le camp anti-houthi.

title: A Washington, les nouveaux QG trumpistes
summary: Depuis son élection, Donald Trump tente d’asseoir son emprise sur la capitale américaine, pourtant traditionnel bastion démocrate, dont la population a voté contre lui à l’écrasante majorité de 92,5 %. Dans la droite ligne de cette croisade MAGA, plusieurs lieux de la ville sont désormais investis par les fidèles du président. Parmi ces repaires, une brasserie très carnivore, une église évangélique et un club réservé aux ultrariches.

title: Sead Turcalo, historien : « Pour Poutine, la Bosnie et le Kosovo, présentés comme des conflits gelés, sont des outils contre l’Occident »
summary: Les conflits en Ukraine et dans les Balkans sont interconnectés, estime le professeur de géopolitique dans un entretien au « Monde ». Trente ans après l’accord de paix de Dayton, il observe Washington se rapprocher de l’« axe illibéral » à l’œuvre en Europe.

title: Le sombre bilan de deux mois de prétendu « cessez-le-feu » à Gaza
summary: Depuis l’entrée en vigueur de la trêve du 10 octobre, près de 400 Palestiniens ont été tués dans la bande de Gaza, où la majorité de la population continue de vivre dans des conditions désastreuses, observe l’historien Jean-Pierre Filiu dans sa chronique.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : le point sur la situation
summary: L’Ukraine a lancé, samedi soir, une attaque de drones contre la Russie, visant notamment la centrale électrique de Smolensk et des dépôts pétroliers. L’envoyé spécial américain Steve Witkoff doit rencontrer Volodymyr Zelensky et des Européens à Berlin durant le week-end.

title: Le chercheur Nate Soares, « doomer » de l’IA à Berkeley, prévoit la fin de l’humanité : « C’est de la folie de les laisser essayer »
summary: Passé par Microsoft et Google, aujourd’hui à la tête d’un laboratoire consacré à la recherche sur l’intelligence des machines, le chercheur prévient : l’homme ne contrôle pas complètement le développement de la superintelligence sur le point d’émerger. Au risque que celle-ci cherche à le détruire.

title: La Bosnie dans les limbes de l’après-guerre, trente ans après la signature des accords de Dayton
summary: Les tensions alimentées par les nationalistes serbes et croates restent vives malgré la signature, le 14 décembre 1995, du texte qui a mis fin à la guerre en Bosnie-Herzégovine. Entre héritages douloureux et espoirs fragiles, le pays demeure profondément divisé.

title: « La bonne nouvelle, c’est que la Chine, le plus grand pollueur de la planète, a commencé à se dépolluer »
summary: Les Chinois sont en passe de réussir leur pari de verdir leur économie. Certes, ils continuent d’ouvrir des centrales à charbon, mais celles-ci, plus souples que les anciennes, sont conçues pour intervenir en appui des énergies renouvelables, explique l’économiste Cédric Philibert dans un entretien au « Monde ».

title: Présidentielle au Chili : la « chronique d’une défaite annoncée » de la gauche face à l’extrême droite
summary: Le candidat ultraconservateur José Antonio Kast est le favori du second tour de l’élection présidentielle qui l’oppose, dimanche, à la communiste Jeannette Jara, ancienne ministre du président de gauche sortant, Gabriel Boric.

title: Malala Yousafzai, militante pakistanaise : « Le vrai courage, c’est de continuer d’agir... surtout si on a peur »
summary: « Je ne serais pas arrivée là si… » Chaque semaine, « Le Monde » interroge une personnalité sur un moment décisif de son existence. A 28 ans, la Prix Nobel de la paix 2014 revient sur sa révolte précoce contre les talibans.

title: Eglise catholique : le concile Vatican II a-t-il précipité la déchristianisation en France ?
summary: Le 8 décembre 1965, à Rome, le pape Paul VI clôturait le concile Vatican II, dont l’ambition était de réconcilier l’Eglise catholique avec le monde moderne. Au même moment, en France, l’assistance à la messe déclinait brutalement. Soixante ans après la clôture du concile, la thèse d’une responsabilité de Vatican II dans la déchristianisation de la France suscite la controverse.

title: Fight, la petite agence derrière la victoire de Zohran Mamdani à New York
summary: Le maire nouvellement élu lui doit en partie son éclatante victoire. L’agence de communication politique Fight, fondée après la déroute de Kamala Harris à la présidentielle, entend incarner l’avenir du Parti démocrate, dont elle dénonce les trahisons. Un renouveau ancré à gauche, porté par des candidats en dehors du sérail et par des spots de campagne originaux.

title: Les traversées illégales de migrants vers le Royaume-Uni ont repris après une pause de quatre semaines
summary: Selon plusieurs observateurs, cette période record depuis sept ans sans arrivée de migrants sur le sol britannique était due à de mauvaises conditions météorologiques.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Gaza's health ministry has reported that three bodies were transferred to hospital in the last 24 hours, boosting the death toll of Palestinians killed by Israel since October 2023 to 70,654 people.

  • The bodies belonged to two people killed by Israeli fire, while another was recovered by emergency teams from a previous attack.

  • A Palestinian man has died from wounds sustained in an Israeli attack on a tent weeks ago in al-Mawasi, near Khan Younis in southern Gaza, Wafa news agency is reporting, citing medical sources.

  • Israeli media is reporting that Israeli forces killed senior Hamas commander Raad Saad, along with at least four other people, in a strike on Gaza on Saturday.

  • The Israeli army says it killed a Palestinian near the so-called yellow line in northern Gaza, an area where Israeli forces have redeployed under the ceasefire agreement.

  • A senior Palestinian official has condemned comments by the US ambassador to Israel that appeared to justify Israeli approval for 19 new settlements, calling the stance a clear breach of international law and a dangerous attempt to legitimise illegal land grabs.

  • Jordan's foreign ministry says it “strongly condemns the Israeli government’s ratification of the establishment and legalisation of 19 illegal colonial settlements in the occupied West Bank”.

  • Israeli forces arrested four Palestinians in a fresh wave of raids across the occupied West Bank this morning, the Palestinian Prisoners’ Media Office (ASRA) is reporting.

  • Six Palestinian families have left their homes in the at-Taawon neighbourhood of Nablus after Israel’s High Court ordered the buildings to be demolished by the end of the year, according to the Wafa news agency.

  • The head of the World Health Organization says Israeli restrictions continue to obstruct the entry of laboratory and diagnostic equipment into Gaza, hampering urgent medical response efforts.

title: Israeli army says it killed Palestinian during patrol in Jenin area
summary:
Israeli army says it killed Palestinian during patrol in Jenin area

The Israeli military says its forces killed a Palestinian during a patrol in the Silat al-Khartiyat area of Jenin, in the occupied West Bank.

The military said no Israeli soldiers were injured in the incident.

title: Israeli military confirms killing of top Hamas commander Raad Saad in Gaza City drone strike
summary:
Israeli military confirms killing of top Hamas commander Raad Saad in Gaza City drone strike

A senior Hamas commander has been killed in an Israeli drone strike in Gaza City on Saturday, the Israeli military has confirmed.

Raad Saad was killed alongside three others when his car was targeted near al-Nabulsi square in western Gaza City, according to Israeli media reports.

Gaza's health ministry said that four people were killed in the attack, with at least 25 others wounded.

Al Jazeera Arabic is reporting that at least five people were killed in the attack.

The Israeli military confirmed in a statement that Saad had been killed in an attack on Hamas' production headquarters in Gaza, adding that the strike was coordinated with the Israeli intelligence agency, Shin Bet.

Read more: Israeli military confirms killing of top Hamas commander Raad Saad in Gaza City drone strike

title: Israel kills three Palestinians in Gaza
summary:
Israel kills three Palestinians in Gaza

The Israeli army says it killed a Palestinian near the so-called yellow line in northern Gaza, an area where Israeli forces have redeployed under the ceasefire agreement.

Israeli forces have repeatedly opened fire on Palestinians who approach the unmarked demarcation line, a pattern that has resulted in the killing and wounding of civilians, including women and children, since the October ceasefire.

title: WHO chief says Israel blocking vital medical equipment from Gaza
summary:
WHO chief says Israel blocking vital medical equipment from Gaza

The head of the World Health Organization says Israeli restrictions continue to obstruct the entry of laboratory and diagnostic equipment into Gaza, hampering urgent medical response efforts.

Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said on X that his agency faces “challenges” from Israel when attempting to bring essential medical supplies into the besieged territory.

“Many items have been denied entry on the grounds of being classified as dual-use,” he said, stressing that the equipment is “vital” for the “timely detection, response, and treatment of people” suffering from acute respiratory illnesses.

Tedros also expressed concern over deaths reported in Gaza over the past day during severe weather, suggesting that many of them could have been avoided if Israel had not restricted the flow of humanitarian aid.

title: Jordan's foreign ministry condemns Israel’s approval of 19 West Bank settlements
summary:
Jordan's foreign ministry condemns Israel’s approval of 19 West Bank settlements

Jordan's foreign ministry says it “strongly condemns the Israeli government’s ratification of the establishment and legalisation of 19 illegal colonial settlements in the occupied West Bank”.

In a statement, the ministry described the decision as “a blatant violation of international law” and “international humanitarian law”, warning that it directly undermines “efforts for a two-state solution”.

The statement added that “Israel has no sovereignty over the occupied West Bank”, rejecting any legal or political basis for the move.

Israel’s cabinet approved the establishment and retroactive legalisation of the 19 settlements on Friday. Settlements across the occupied West Bank are regarded as illegal under international law.

title: Three US personnel killed in Islamic State attack on convoy in central Syria
summary:
Three US personnel killed in Islamic State attack on convoy in central Syria

Submitted by MEE staff on Sat, 12/13/2025 - 18:44
US forces came under deadly attack in central Syria as Washington steps up coordination with Damascus.
US forces patrol in Syria's northeastern city Qamishli, in the Hasakeh province, on January 9, 2025. (AFP)
Off

Three US military personnel, including two army soldiers and a civilian interpreter, were killed on Saturday after a suspected Islamic State (IS) attacker targeted a joint American-Syrian convoy in central Syria, the US military said.

US Central Command said three additional US soldiers sustained injuries in the attack, which took place in the town of Palmyra. The command said a lone gunman opened fire while US troops were carrying out what it described as a “key leader engagement”.

“Partner forces” killed the attacker, US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth said in a social media post.

IS did not immediately claim responsibility. However, a senior US official said early assessments point to the armed group as the likely perpetrator. The official added that the attack occurred in an area outside Syrian government control.

Syria’s Foreign Minister Asaad al-Sheibani condemned what he described as a terrorist attack targeting a joint Syrian-US counterterrorism patrol near the city of Palmyra.

In a statement posted on X, Sheibani offered condolences to those affected by the attack.

"We extend our condolences to the families of the victims and to the American government and people, and we wish the injured a speedy recovery," he wrote.

The US military said it would withhold the identities of those killed until 24 hours after notifying their families.

Syria’s state news agency SANA, citing a security source, reported that two Syrian service members were wounded in the attack. The source said US helicopters evacuated the injured to a US base in the Al-Tanf region near Syria’s border with Iraq.

Tom Barrack, the US ambassador to Turkey and Washington’s special envoy to Syria, condemned the assault.

“We mourn the loss of three brave U.S. service members and civilian personnel and wish a speedy recovery to the Syrian troops wounded in the attack,” Barrack said in a statement. “We remain committed to defeating terrorism with our Syrian partners.”

The attack comes weeks after Syria announced a political cooperation agreement with the US-led coalition fighting IS, unveiled around the time Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa visited the White House.

US-led forces have intensified air raids and ground operations against suspected IS cells in recent months, often alongside Syrian security forces. Syria last month said it arrested more than 70 people nationwide accused of links to the group.

The United States maintains several hundred troops in northeastern Syria.

Inside Syria
News
Post Date Override
0
Update Date
Mon, 05/04/2020 - 21:19
Update Date Override
0

title: Israeli forces detain 14-year-old boy during raid near Nablus
summary:
Israeli forces detain 14-year-old boy during raid near Nablus

Israeli forces have detained a 14-year-old Palestinian boy during a raid in the town of Beita, south of Nablus, according to the Wafa news agency.

Local sources told the Palestinian outlet that soldiers arrested Taim Raed Hamayel during the operation, which took place in the occupied West Bank.

The detention comes as Palestinians across the West Bank continue to face a sharp rise in Israeli military raids and settler violence, unfolding alongside Israel’s ongoing genocidal war on Gaza.

title: Six Palestinian families flee homes after Israeli demolition order
summary:
Six Palestinian families flee homes after Israeli demolition order

Six Palestinian families have left their homes in the at-Taawon neighbourhood of Nablus after Israel’s High Court ordered the buildings to be demolished by the end of the year, according to the Wafa news agency.

Residents said they evacuated after receiving final demolition notices, as Israeli authorities insist the properties fall within Area C, which makes up about 60 percent of the occupied West Bank and remains under full Israeli control.

One of the affected residents, Laith Abed, told the Palestinian outlet that officials based their decision on this classification.

The families, however, reject the claim, saying the homes are located in Area B, where Palestinians hold civil authority, although Israel retains overarching security control.

The forced displacement comes amid mounting concern from the United Nations. The UN’s humanitarian agency warned this week that Israeli demolition orders have displaced more than 1,000 Palestinians in Area C since the start of the year, marking the second highest figure recorded since 2009.

title: ISIS ambush targets US troops in Syria, Pentagon says
summary:
ISIS ambush targets US troops in Syria, Pentagon says

US Central Command said on Saturday that an ISIS fighter carried out an armed ambush targeting US personnel in Syria.

The command said US troops came under fire in the Palmyra area of central Syria, prompting an immediate response. US forces engaged the attacker and killed the gunman responsible for the ambush.

The Pentagon said the attack took place while US soldiers were holding a meeting with local leaders in Palmyra, underscoring the risks facing troops during engagement missions on the ground.

US Special Envoy for Syria Tom Barrack condemned the attack, describing it as a “cowardly terrorist ambush” that targeted a joint US-Syrian patrol.

title: Palestinian official slams US envoy over backing Israeli settlements
summary:
Palestinian official slams US envoy over backing Israeli settlements

A senior Palestinian official has condemned comments by the US ambassador to Israel that appeared to justify Israeli approval for 19 new settlements, calling the stance a clear breach of international law and a dangerous attempt to legitimise illegal land grabs.

Rouhi Fattouh, chairman of the Palestinian National Council, said the remarks by Ambassador Mike Huckabee amount to political cover for settlement expansion, which international law explicitly prohibits. He said Israel’s settlement drive, regardless of whether it is framed as licensing, urban growth or administrative planning, remains illegal under international humanitarian law.

Fattouh pointed to UN Security Council Resolution 2334, which affirms that all settlement activity in the occupied Palestinian territories, including East Jerusalem, has no legal validity and must cease immediately. He said attempts to portray new settlements as falling short of annexation rely on manipulating legal language and do not alter the reality on the ground.

He said settlements function as a tool to impose irreversible facts, erode Palestinian self-determination and entrench Israel’s occupation system. Rebranding such measures, he added, does nothing to change their colonial nature.

title: Israeli military confirms killing of top Hamas commander Raad Saad in Gaza City drone strike
summary:
Israeli military confirms killing of top Hamas commander Raad Saad in Gaza City drone strike

Submitted by MEE staff on Sat, 12/13/2025 - 15:31
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he and Defence Minister Israel Katz ordered the attack
Palestinians inspect the site of an Israeli strike on a car in Gaza City, 13 December 2025 (Reuters/Dawoud Abu Alkas)
Off

A senior Hamas commander has been killed in an Israeli drone strike in Gaza City on Saturday, the Israeli military has confirmed.

Raad Saad was killed alongside three others when his car was targeted near al-Nabulsi square in western Gaza City, according to Israeli media reports.

Gaza's health ministry said that four people were killed in the attack, with at least 25 others wounded.

Al Jazeera Arabic is reporting that at least five people were killed in the attack.

The Israeli military confirmed in a statement that Saad had been killed in an attack on Hamas' production headquarters in Gaza, adding that the strike was coordinated with the Israeli intelligence agency, Shin Bet.

It claimed that in recent weeks, Hamas was trying to “restore its capabilities and strengthen itself", describing Saad as "one of the last senior veterans remaining in the Gaza Strip", who "held a series of senior positions and was close to Marwan Issa, deputy head of the military wing" of Hamas.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said that he and Defence Minister Israel Katz had ordered the attack in response to an explosion which injured Israeli soldiers in Gaza. 

An Israeli defence official described Saad as the head of Hamas' weapons manufacturing force, while Hamas sources have said he is second only to the group's latest military chief, Izz al-Din al-Haddad, according to Reuters.

The same sources said that Saad previously ran the group's Gaza City battalion, its largest and best-resourced.

Hamas issued a statement condemning the attack, saying it represented "a blatant violation" of the fragile Gaza ceasefire agreement which came into effect in October.

“This crime reaffirms that the [Israeli] occupation is deliberately seeking to undermine and sabotage the ceasefire agreement through its escalating and continuous violations,” the group said in a post on Telegram.

It did not confirm whether a member of the group had been targeted in the attack.

US news site Axios reported that Israel had not warned the US in advance of the strike.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Regional neighbors convene in Tehran to discuss Afghanistan’s future
summary: On December 14, 2025, Tehran hosted a high-level regional meeting on Afghanistan, bringing together neighboring countries and key regional partners, including Pakistan, Russia, Uzbekistan, China, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan, to exchange views on the latest developments in the country and present Iran’s perspective on Afghanistan and South Asian regional dynamics.

title: Iran will not retreat from its legal rights; dictated negotiations unacceptable: Senior MP
summary: Tehran, IRNA – A member of Parliament’s National Security and Foreign Policy Committee says Iran will not back down from the nation’s legal right to peaceful nuclear energy and will not accept negotiations imposed by the US.

title: Israel’s killing of Palestinians using US tech assistance is ‘utter barbarity’: Baqaei
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baqaei has described Israel’s killing of Palestinians in Gaza, particularly children, with the assistance of American technology companies as “systematic brutality” and “utter barbarity.”

title: Last day of 2025 Asian Youth Para Games
summary: The 2025 Asian Para Youth Para Games concluded on December 13, 2025, with the Boccia competitions. Boccia is a precision sport played individually, in pairs, or in teams of three.

title: Marble Palace; Museum of Iranian art
summary: Marble Palace is considered one of Tehran’s most beautiful and valuable landmarks, located in the heart of the city. The palace, known as the Museum of Iranian art, dates back to the early Pahlavi era.

title: Women’s Volleyball Premier League in Iran: Saipa vs. Moghavemat Shahrdari of Tabriz
summary: The match between Saipa and Moghavemat Shahrdari of Tabriz was held on Saturday (December 13, 2025) in the third week of the first round of the 24th season of Iran’s Women’s Volleyball Premier League at the Volleyball Federation Hall, ending in a 3–0 victory for Saipa.

title: Iran, Ethiopia parliament speakers hold talks in Tehran
summary: Tagesse Chafo, the speaker of the House of People’s Representatives of Ethiopia, met with Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf, the speaker of the Iranian Parliament, in Tehran on December 13, 2025, for talks on bilateral parliamentary relations.

title: Araghchi: Iran does not seek war; US cannot be trusted
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has emphasized that Iran never seeks war, but it wants to resolve issues through diplomacy.

title: Pezeshkian: BRICS offers new model for stronger member cooperation
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian has stressed the potential of the BRICS group as a valuable platform for enhancing interactions and deepening economic and political ties among member states.

title: Pezeshkian stresses need for deepening Iran-Kazakhstan ties
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian has underscored the need for deeper and broader relations between Iran and Kazakhstan, saying that cooperation is in the interest of the people of the two countries and the region as a whole.

title: Iranian girls’ goalball team dedicates gold medal to martyrs of 12-day war
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The head coach of the Iranian youth goalball team, Mojgan Karbi, has dedicated the gold medal won by the girls’ goalball team at the Asian Youth Para Games to the martyrs of the 12-day war.

title: Iranian ambassador, Turkish deputy FM stress closer ties in Ankara meeting
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s ambassador to Turkey has met with the country’s newly appointed deputy foreign minister in Ankara, with both sides underscoring the importance of close and longstanding ties between Tehran and Ankara.

title: Iran in contact with agency whenever necessary
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – Iran's Foreign Ministry Spokesman says that Tehran is in contact with the IAEA whenever it is necessary, adding that Rafael Grossi's claims concerning Iran will not change the realities on the ground.

title: Regional solutions sole viable path to Afghanistan stability
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – Iran’s Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi said on Sunday that no extra-regional formula can resolve Afghanistan’s challenges, stressing that neighboring countries remain the most natural actors in addressing this issue.

title: Iran hosts key regional summit on Afghanistan
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – Tehran is hosting a high-level regional meeting aimed at discussing developments in Afghanistan, bringing together neighboring states and key regional powers.

title: Autumn rainfall refreshes holy city of Qom
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – Autumn rainfall brought a renewed sense of freshness to the holy city of Qom, creating a pleasant atmosphere and delighting pilgrims and residents alike.

title: Talks underway with parties over Iran's nuclear program
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – Rafael Grossi, Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), said talks aimed at resolving Iran’s nuclear issue remain ongoing.

title: Iranian ambassador, Turkish deputy FM stress closer ties
summary: Iran’s ambassador to Turkey has met with the country’s newly appointed deputy foreign minister in Ankara, with both sides underscoring the importance of close and longstanding ties between Tehran and Ankara.

title: Trump vows retaliation after two US troops killed in Syria
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump vowed retaliation Saturday after two US Army soldiers and a civilian US interpreter were killed in an attack in Syria.

title: UN chief condemns ‘horrific’ drone attack in Sudan
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – A drone attack has hit a United Nations facility in war-torn Sudan, killing six peacekeepers, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said.

title: 11 killed, injured in shooting at Brown University
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – Eleven people were killed and injured in a shooting that took place on Saturday on the campus of Brown University.

title: Armed Forces ready to defend Iran under any circumstances
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi said Iran’s armed forces remain fully prepared to defend the country under any circumstances, stressing that Tehran prefers diplomacy over war but will not ignore possible threats.

title: Front pages of Iran's English dailies on December 14
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 14 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran's English language dailies on Sunday, December 14.

title: Pezeshkian lauds Kazakhstan's contribution to regional peace
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 13 (MNA) – Kazakhstan is playing an increasingly prominent role in ensuring regional stability and strengthening international security, President of the Islamic Republic of Iran Masoud Pezeshkian has said.

title: رفیعی: ۲۰ هزار نفر در اعتکاف رجبیه خراسان شمالی شرکت می‌کنند
summary: بجنورد- مدیرکل تبلیغات اسلامی خراسان شمالی، گفت: پیش‌بینی می‌شود امسال حدود ۲۰ هزار نفر در مراسم اعتکاف رجبیه استان شرکت کنند و بیش از ۲۰۰ مسجد برای میزبانی از معتکفین اعلام آمادگی کرده‌اند.

title: بازدید معاون رسانه‌ای وزیر فرهنگ از نمایشگاه پژوهش و فناوری
summary: معاون رسانه‌ای وزیر فرهنگ از بیست‌وششمین نمایشگاه بین‌المللی پژوهش، فناوری و فن‌بازار بازدید کرد.

title: کارگاه آلفرد یعقوب‌زاده برگزار شد؛ عکاس مرده، عکاس خوبی نیست!
summary: آلفرد یعقوب‌زاده در کارگاه انتقال تجربه «عکاسی جنگ و مستند اجتماعی» عنوان کرد که تشخیص، هوشیاری و آگاهی، ابزار مهم عکاسی جنگ و مستند اجتماعی است.

title: انهدام مقر فرماندهی وابسته به وزارت دفاع اوکراین
summary: منابع امنیتی در روسیه از انهدام یک مقر فرماندهی اطلاعات وابسته به وزارت دفاع اوکراین در منطقه چرنیگوف خبر دادند.

title: حقوق نیروهای نظامی باید حداقل ۲۰ درصد بالاتر از سایر کارکنان دولت باشد
summary: نماینده مردم تهران گفت: حقوق و مزایای نیروهای نظامی باید حداقل ۲۰ درصد بالاتر از سایر کارکنان دولت باشد و مجلس با جدیت پیگیر احقاق حقوق ارتشیان و سپاهیان و حمایت از تلاش‌های آنان است.

title: بازوند:اعتبار سفر ریاست‌جمهوری محور بجنورد به سنخواست کامل تأمین شد
summary: بجنورد- معاون وزیر راه و شهرسازی در جریان بازدید از محور بجنورد–سنخواست اعلام کرد که اعتبار مصوب این پروژه در سفر ریاست‌جمهوری به‌طور کامل تأمین شده است.
